metadata.description:
My second song on Sound is another oldie.
Written in 2018, during a time where all I was writing was melancholic tunes, "Your Mother" stood out as a little tongue in cheek gem, ironic and direct at the same time.

I'm Italian and blunt. But I am also romantic, and just like many of us, I look for love. And so many times, when we think we found it, it turns out to be not what we expected. 

I do like to take things lightly though, and music allows me to do it even more. Melodies and lyrics help me turn something upsetting into something that makes me (and maybe others) smile.

This is a one take acoustic recording of my song "Your Mother" with my friend Ed Prosek on trumpet. 
Once again I feel so blessed that web3 allows me to put out songs that were written such a long time ago, and were never given a chance to see the light of day. Well now they can shine, and find a home with you guys.

lyrics.text:
Spent so many years singing sad songs 
I think I’ve had enough 
I just wanna fall in love

Your mother must have been a saint
Looking after you this way
You look at me the same way but you know I ain’t
I just wanna fall in love

I’m done picking up each mess you make
Each time you hurt yourself somehow it’s my mistake 
I’ve taken all of you that i cared to take
I just wanna fall in love 

Spent so many years singing sad songs 
I think I’ve had enough 
I just wanna fall in love

Spent so many years wishing for the chance  
To mean it when I say 
I just wanna fall in love

metadata.name: Your Mother #1
metadata.title: Your Mother
